review_blob: Bottle, poured with thin off-white head, with a rather clear amber color.  A bit on the weak side for taste, and finishes too bitter for the initial flavor.  Does not have the strong piney-hop flavor I crave, but more on the malty side.  I was not impressed, but it was not terrible either.
URINE aroma, taste, appearance.  This is the worst of the American macros.  I would rather have water.

Fantastic!  The most drinkable double IPA I have had yet, though I am I admit, new to the Doubles.  Not very bitter at all compared to some others I have tried.  Better tasting than many traditional IPAs.  Look out for the 9.1%, its there even though you cant taste it!

Very drinkable IPA.  Finishes light and clean, does not make you feel full.  Has a good flavor, nothing to complain about.  Seems to get better as it gets warmer.  60-65 degrees would probably be the best.
Was my 2nd favorite from Lengthwise when I used to live in Bakersfield.  Not quite hoppy enough, but darn good anyway.  Im looking for this bottle here in CT.

This was my favorite when we used to live in B-town.  I would get growlers of this all the time.  It did finish a bit on the bitter side at times.  It went extremely well with their firey chili with no beans.  Two pints at the pub would get the job done.  Lengthwise was my Sunday afternoon hangout and a great place to watch live bands on the elevated stage behind the bar.

A great baseball watching beer when you are thirsty in the summer.  Goes good with your goofy friends and cards too.  Hands down the best cheap american beer out there.  They slide down quick and easy, so why does it need to taste good?  For gods sake DO NOT let one get warm!!!!  11.50 for a hamburger?!? YALL MUST BE CRAZY!

Surly it is the best can beer I have tasted yet!  A great cold weather drinker with a full but not too heavy flavor.  I tried this for the first time last night and loved it.  Im a big fan of IPAs and other hoppy beers, and this is the bees knees.  Im glad it has gone national, so we can enjoy it here on the East coast!
